headline.print_headline: Africa; Rwanda: Effort Advances to Extend Tenure of Kagame as President
headline.main: Rwanda: Effort Advances to Extend Tenure of Kagame as President

snippet: President Paul Kagame of Rwanda may stay on until 2034, a move opposed by the United States and other aid donors.
abstract: Rwandan Pres Paul Kagame is two ballots away from being able to potentially extend his presidency until 2034; change, which is opposed by United States and others, still needs approval of the upper house of Parliament and national referendum, but will likely pass.
lead_paragraph: President Paul Kagame of Rwanda may stay on until 2034, a move opposed by the United States and other aid donors.
